ilo: Critically reflect on contemporary theories and pedagogies of language and literacy education, and the implications for effective teaching practice.
Analyse and apply knowledge of the language and literacy demands of learning areas to differentiate teaching and learning for students across the full range of abilities.
Integrate teaching strategies and resources, including ICT, that support all students to successfully negotiate the increasing complexity of literacy in secondary education.
Select assessment, diagnostic and feedback strategies to assess and support the language and literacy development of students across the full range of abilities.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Report: Report on oral language analysis
Planning document: Written document on supporting student reading and writing

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on-campus classes, and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)
